projects.title: Island House
projects.details: This is a multi-page, custom-designed website developed for a small business client. I utilised HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript and a splash of jQuery. I learned a lot from this project and the client was very happy with the result.

projects.title: React Calculator
projects.details: This is a fun little calculator app created using React, learning a lot about proper state management along the way.

projects.title: Adventure Shop
projects.details: This is a full stack application created from the ground up using Express, React, Redux, Postgresql, Node, and the Paypal Dev Api. The application utilises JWT authentication, bcrypt password hashing,  and server/client side route guarding among many other packages. The payment gateway is handled by Paypal and setup to use Paypal's sandbox api. This app was an absolute pleasure to build.

projects.title: Game of Life
projects.details: This is Conway's Game of Life, created using vanilla JavaScript and HTML Canvas. It's surprisingly addictive to watch - click on the live preview to see for yourself.

projects.title: Project Euler
projects.details: This repository is part of an ongoing project with the WB[Collective] team. I am focussing on learning more mathematics while also completing Project Euler challenges. I have personally decided to code it in C++ to improve my lower level programming skills.

projects.title: ToDo App (PERN)
projects.details: This is a fullstack PERN (Postgresql, Express, React, Node) Todo Application. The app is fairly simple but you can do all the CRUD functionalities and everything is stored nicely on a remote database. This app was a pleasure to make and an excellent learning opportunity since I had to implement everything from the group up and bring together everything I had learned so far. I decided not to use a database ORM and instead just use the PG node package to do all my database related calls.

projects.title: Clear View
projects.details: This website is one of the first I ever made using HTML, CSS and JavaScript. It is a mock travel website and never fails to make me feel sentimental for my earliest days of programming.

projects.title: Ship Loader (C#)
projects.details: This is a C# OOP game. It uses inherence and other object oriented features to create a fun little ship cargo loading simulator. I don’t usually write C# but when I do I love how robust and exact it is. Strong typing for the win!

projects.title: Lifespan Counter
projects.details: This counter app was made using Vue.js to calculate an individual’s predicted remaining lifespan. For a quick project of a few hours, I found the output rather satisfying.

projects.title: Pairs Game
projects.details: This is a little match the pairs game I made using JS. Give it a shot if you have a few minutes and see if you can beat my 45 clicks win

projects.title: Mykee's Prime
projects.details: This is a fun little prime game I made using React in honour of Mr Mykee. Wonderful lad that he is.

projects.title: Ecommerce
projects.details: This is an e-commerce node back-end application I started developing using express, Mongoose and handlebars. The code is messy and unmodulated and the website not very optimised with unacceptable levels of lag. This was more a fun activity for me in order to see how long it would take to prototype an e-commerce website.

projects.title: Margaux Gallery
projects.details: This was a gallery website I made with Vue.js and Vuetify.js. I can’t emphasis enough how much I enjoyed working with Vue. For the database I used the very intuitive noSql database Firebase. Now it has a range of outdated dependencies, so is currently offline.

projects.title: Trump Invasion Shooter
projects.details: This is a simple C# space shooter game created using .net Forms. Since it's close to the 2020 US election I just had to put Trump's face on the aliens. Vote Him Out!
